DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Diagnosis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to further classify a diagnosis of acute Graft vs. Host Disease (AGVHD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of graft versus host disease, an incompatibility reaction (which may be fatal) in a subject (host) of low immunological competence (deficient lymphoid tissue) who has been the recipient of immunologically competent lymphoid tissue from a donor who lacks at least one antigen possessed by the recipient host._A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing within the first 100 days post-transplant, but with short duration.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Classic Graft vs. Host Disease (AGVHD) onset < or = 100 days post transplant
Acute Graft vs. Host Disease (AGVHD) onset > 100 days post transplant

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR clinical trial
